thai: sà-wàt-dii khráp khun phâaw khun mâae.
sà-wàt-dii khráp khun jeem. sà-baai dii mǎi khráp.
sà-baai dii khráp. láaeo khun phâaw gàp khun mâae lâ khráp.
english: I'm fine. And you, dad and mom?

thai: khun jeem nîi ní-chaa lûuk-sǎao khǎawng phǒm khráp.
english: James, this is Nicha, my daughter.

thai: sà-wàt-dii khâ. yin-dii thîi dâai rúu-jàk khâ.
sà-wàt-dii khráp. yin-dii thîi dâai rúu-jàk chên gan khráp.
english: Hello. Nice to meet you, too.

thai: chûuai thǔue grà-bpǎo mǎi khá. óoi... grà-bpǎo bai níi nàk mâak.
english: Shall I help carry the bags? Oh, this bag is so heavy!

thai: mâi bpen rai khráp. phǒm thǔue eeng dâai khráp. rót yùu thîi-nǎi khráp.
english: Don't worry about it. I can carry it myself. Where is the car?
Uh...the car is way over there.

thai: roong-riian khǎawng phǒm khuue dtùek nóon
english: My school is that building over there.

thai: khon thîi sài chút sǐi-nám-dtaan khuue khrai khráp.
english: Who is the person wearing a brown outfit?

thai: láaeo dèk phûu-chaai khon nán thîi sài phâa sǐi-sôm bpen phrá-sǒng châi mǎi khráp.
english: And that boy wearing orange cloth is a monk, right?

thai: mâi châi khráp. nân neen khráp.
pueak rao thǔeng bâan láaeo khâ.

english: It's the house with the bamboo.
the person who is wearing a red hat
This is James. He's an exchange student from the United States.

thai: sà-wàt-dii khráp. yin-dii thîi dâai rúu-jàk thúk khon khráp.
english: Hello. I'm glad to meet everyone.

thai: jeem khon níi khuue khun dtaa.
sùuan khon níi khuue khun yaai.
sà-wàt-dii jâ jeem. rûup làaw ná níi. mii faaen rǔue yang lâ.
english: Hello, James. You're extra handsome. Do you have a girlfriend yet?

thai: jeem khá. nîi náawng-sǎao khǎawng dì-chǎn. chûue jíiap khâ.
english: James, this is my younger sister. Her name is Jiap.

thai: sà-wàt-dii khâ. phîi jeem jà yùu thîi-nîi naan thâo-rài khá.
english: Hello. How long are you going to stay here?
What did you come to Thailand to study?
thai: jeem maa riian à-rai thîi muueang-thai khá.

english: I came to study Thai at Chiang Mai University.
thai: phǒm maa riian phaa-sǎa-thai thîi má-hǎa-wít-thá-yaa-lai chiiang mài khráp.

english: You don't have to go to the University to study. I can teach you. This is a spoon. This is a fork. This is a glass.
thai: phîi jeem mâi dtâwng bpai riian thîi má-hǎa-wít-thá-yaa-lai ràawk khâ. nǔu sǎawn hâi dâai. nîi khuue cháawn. nîi khuue sâawm. nîi khuue gâaeo.

english: James, tomorrow I'll take you to the university. I want you to meet one professor.
thai: jeem phrûng-níi rao jà phaa jeem bpai má-hǎa-wít-thá-yaa-lai ná. yàak hâi jeem phóp gàp aa-jaan thâan nùeng.

english: Great. What time will we go?
thai: dii looei khráp. phûuak-rao jà bpai gan gìi moong khráp.
thâan bpen aa-jaan phaa-sǎa-thai khǎawng jeem

english: word used after negative statement to make the sense milder.
your shoes are near the door, between Father's shoes and Mother's shoes.
thai: raawng-tháao khǎawng jeem yùu glâi gàp bprà-dtuu. rá-wàang raawng-tháao khǎawng khun phâaw gàp raawng-tháao khǎawng khun mâae khâ.

english: You can call me by my nickname, Nune
thai: jeem rîiak chûue-lên khǎawng rao gâaw dâai khâ nûn.

english: Okay. Thank you very much, Nune. Is the university far from your house?
thai: khráp. khàawp khun mâak khráp nûn. má-hǎa-wít-thá-yaa-lai yùu glai jàak bâan mǎi khráp.

english: Not far. We can ride a motorcycle. It takes five minutes.
thai: mâi glai khâ. khìi maaw-dtooe-sai bpai khâ. chái wee-laa hâa naa-thii.

english: The cat is under the table.
My house is located between the school and a restaurant.
thai: bâan khǎawng phǒm yùu rá-wàang roong-riian gàp ráan-aa-hǎan

english: His house is near the market.
thai: bâan khǎo yùu glâi gàp dtà-làat

english: The office is far from my house.
thai: thîi-tham-ngaan yùu glai jàak bâan khǎawng chǎn

english: Excuse me. Where is the library?
thai: khǎaw-thôot ná khráp. hâwng-sà-mùt yùu thîi-nǎi khráp.

english: Walk straight until you get to the four-way intersection with a big clock.
thai: dooen dtrong bpai thǔeng sìi-yâaek thîi mii naa-lí-gaa an yài ná khá.

english: Then walk straight another one hundred meters. You'll see the library on the right-hand side.
thai: láaeo gâaw dooen dtrong bpai ìik nùeng-ráawy méet. jà hěn hâwng-sà-mùt yùu thaang khwǎa muue khâ.

english: You speak Thai very clearly. Do you study Thai here?
thai: khun phûut phaa-sǎa-thai chát mâak looei khâ. riian phaa-sǎa-thai yùu thîi-nîi rǒoe khá.

english: Thank you. I started studying Thai in America first. Now I'm an exchange student.
thai: khàawp khun khráp. phǒm rôoem riian thîi à-mee-rí-gaa gàawn. dtaawn níi bpen nák-sùek-sǎa-lâaek-bpliian khráp.
dii jang looei khâ. khǎaw hâi chôok dii ná khá.

english: Turn right at the four-way intersection.
Go this way. Then turn left at the three-way intersection. There is a bank on the right-hand side, between a restaurant and a coffee shop
thai: bpai thaang níi. láaeo líiao sáai thîi sǎam-yâaek. mii thá-naa-khaan yùu thaang khwǎa-muue rá-wàang ráan-aa-hǎan gàp ráan-gaa-faae

english: Excuse me. Where are the books about Thai culture?
thai: khǎaw-thôot ná khráp. nǎng-sǔue gìiao-gàp wát-thá-ná-tham thai yùu thîi-nǎi khráp.
yùu khâang bon khâ. chán sǎam.

english: It's downstairs on the third floor.
thai: yùu khâang lâang thîi chán sǎam khráp.

english: Huh...and which floor is this one?
thai: hǎa...láaeo chán níi chán à-rai khráp.

english: Sir...you can't drink a Coke inside the library. You need to go drink it outside.
thai: khun khá...dùuem khóok khâang nai hâwng-sà-mùt mâi dâai khâ. dtâwng àawk bpai dùuem khâang nâawk.

english: I'm waiting for you in front of the cinema.
thai: phǒm raaw khun yùu khâang-nâa roong-nǎng

english: The family that lives upstairs has five children
thai: khrâawp-khruua thîi phák yùu khâang-bon mii lûuk hâa khon

english: inside the office is colder than outside.
thai: khâang-nai thîi tham-ngaan yen gwàa khâang-nâawk

english: Over that way, behind that table
thai: yùu dtrong nán khâ. khâang lǎng dtó dtuua nán.

english: I was born on a Monday
This weekend, I will go to Bangkok

thai: phîi jeem khá. phrûng-níi bpen wan-gòoet khǎawng nǔu khâ.

english: Really? Tomorrow, how many years old will you be?
thai: rǒoe khráp. phrûng-níi náawng jíiap aa-yú jà khróp gìi khùuap khráp.

english: Seven years old. And you were born on which date?
thai: jèt khùaap khâ. láaeo phîi jeem gòoet wan thîi thâo-rài khá.
wan thîi yîi-sìp-bpàaet duuean gan-yaa-yon khráp.

english: Which day? I was born on a Monday.
thai: wan à-rai khá. rao gòoet wan-jan.

english: I was born on a Saturday.
Huh? You don't know your birthday?
thai: hǎa...jeem mâi rúu wan-gòoet khǎawng dtuua eeng rǒoe.

english: Errr...I don't know. In America, it's not important.
thai: òoe...mâi rúu khráp. thîi à-mee-rí-gaa mâi sǎm-khan.
láaeo nûn gòoet wan thîi thâo-rài khráp.

english: November eleventh. In this month there is also Loi Krathong Day.
thai: wan thîi sìp-èt duuean phrúet-sà-jì-gaa-yon khâ. nai duuean níi mii wan laawy grà-thong dûuai ná khá.

english: I love Loi Krathong Day, but I love Songkran Day even more.
thai: jíiap châawp wan laawy grà-thong mâak. dtàae châawp wan sǒng-graan mâak gwàa.

english: Songkran Day is in which month?
thai: wan sǒng-graan yùu nai duuean à-rai khráp.

english: April. Umm...what year were you born in, James?
thai: duuean mee-sǎa-yon khâ. ôoe...láaeo jeem gòoet bpii à-rai rǒoe.

english: Huh? You're really old! Your age is very different from mine. I was born in the year 2544.
thai: hǎa...phîi jeem gàae mâak. aa-yú hàang jàak nǔu yóe mâak. nǔu gòoet bpii sǎawng-phan hâa-ráawy sìi-sìp-sìi.

english: Huh? You come from the future?
No, no. We are talking about the Buddhist Era years. But you were talking about the Christian Era years.
thai: mâi châi mâi châi jeem. rao gam-lang phûut thǔeng bpii phaaw sǎaw yùu khâ. thîi jeem phûut nâ bpen bpii khaaw sǎaw.

english: Loi Krathong Day, river goddess worship festival
My older brother will go back to the United States in June (6th month)
thai: phîi-chaai jà glàp bpai à-mee-rí-gaa duuean thîi hòk

english: Hey, in two weeks we're going to go to Pai. Do you want to come with?
thai: nîi ìik sǎawng aa-thít rao jà bpai bpaai làe. bpai dûuai gan mǎi.

english: I went there last year. It was really fun. So what are you going to do in Pai?
thai: rao khooei bpai mûuea bpii gàawn. sà-nùk mâak mâak looei. wâa dtàae...jà bpai tham à-rai thîi bpaai rǒoe.

english: three years ago, I went rafting on the Colorado River in America. It was very fun.
thai: mûuea sǎam bpii thîi láaeo phǒm khooei lâwng gàeng thîi mâae-náam khoo-loo-raa-dôo thîi à-mee-rí-gaa khráp. sà-nùk mâak mâak.
ngán gâaw bpai dûuai gan sì khráp jeem.

english: He came to Thailand five months ago
thai: khǎo maa muueang-thai hâa duuean thîi láaeo

english: I saw a really funny movie three days ago
thai: chǎn duu nǎng dtà-lòk mâak sǎam wan thîi láaeo

english: In two years, I will buy my own house
thai: iik sǎawng bpii phǒm jà súue bâan eeng

english: In another four days, it will be Mother's birthday
thai: ìik sìi wan jà bpen wan-gòoet khǎawng khun-mâae
rao khooei bpai mûuea bpii gàawn

english: to let you know (kind of show off)

thai: khǎaw nâng dûuai dâai mǎi já.

english: Hey, I just heard from Benz that you and Nune are going to go to Pai with us.
thai: mûuea-gîi dâi yin maa jàak been wâa jeem gàp nûn jà bpai bpaai gàp phûuak-rao rǔue já.

english: Heard Benz also said that you went rafting before on the Colorado River. When did you go there, James?
thai: hěn been lâo hâi fang dûuai wâa jeem kooei bpai lâawng-gàaeng thîi mâae-náam khoo-loo-raa-dôo dûuai. jeem bpai maa mûuea-rài rǔue khá.

english: I went when in 6th year of high school.
thai: bpai maa mûuea dtaawn yùu maaw hòk khráp.

english: It was a lot of fun, but I was little scared.
thai: sà-nùk mâak khráp. dtàae gluua nít-nàwy.

english: So...what do you like to do in your free time, James?
thai: wâa dtàae...wee-laa wâang jeem châawp tham à-rai khá.

english: I like to play the guitar, like to play basketball, and like to watch movies.
thai: châawp lên gii-dtâa châawp lên báas-gét-bawn láaeo gâaw châawp duu nǎng khráp.

english: In that case, you should take your guitar to Pai too. You can play guitar for our friends to hear at dinnertime.
thai: thâa yàang nán jeem gâaw ao gii-dtâa bpai bpaai dûuai sì. jà dâai lên gii-dtâa hâi phûuean-phûuean fang dtaawn thaan khâao.

english: Before, he said that he wasn't going
thai: mûuea gàawn khǎo bàawk wâa jà mâi bpai

english: When I have a problem I like to talk with my mother
thai: mûuea mii bpan-hǎa châawp khui gàp khun mâae

english: when I was a kid, I was very stubborn
thai: dtaawn bpen dèk dì-chǎn dûue mâak

english: My little sister likes to go shopping in her free time
thai: wee-laa wâang náawng-sǎao châawp bpai súue khǎawng

english: Father likes to watch TV when he eats
thai: khun phâaw châawp duu thii-wii dtaawn thaan khâao

english: Hey, Benz! Don't drive so fast. Drive a little more slowly. There are many curves. It's dangerous.
thai: nîi...been, yàa khàp rót reo nák sì. khàp cháa-cháa nàwy. thaang-khóong yóe. an-dtà-raai ná.

english: Yes, ma'am. I'm driving slowly already.
thai: khráp, phǒm khàp cháa-cháa láaeo khráp.
jeem mii gii-dtâa châi mǎi khráp.

english: No, not expensive. It was really cheap. It's a secondhand guitar that was two thousand baht.
thai: mâi phaaeng khráp. thùuk-thùuk. bpen gii-dtâa muue sǎawng raa-khaa sǎawng-phan bàat khráp.

english: Can you play the guitar, Art?
thai: phîi àat lên gii-dtâa dâai mǎi khráp.

english: Is the weather going to be hot in Pai this weekend?
thai: sǎo-aa-thít níi aa-gàat thîi bpaai jà ráawn mǎi khráp.

english: Not hot. The weather is nice and cool.
thai: mâi ráawn khráp. aa-gàat yen sà-baai.

english: If you're cold, you should put on a jacket
thai: thâa khun nǎao sài sûuea-jáek-gèt sì khráp

english: Eat quickly. The food is getting cold.
thai: gin reo reo sì khráp. aa-hǎan jà yen ná
thîi muueang dtoo-giiao mii khon yóe

english: My older sister likes to cut her hair short
thai: phîi-sǎao khǎawng chǎn châawp dtàt phǒm sân

english: The big demon chases the little demon
This trip is the most fun! So...tonight when James plays guitar, who is going to sing?
thai: maa thîiao khráng níi sà-nùk thîi-sùt looei. ôoe...wâa dtàae khuuen níi dtaawn jeem lên gii-dtâa khrai jà ráawng phleeng já.
bpôen ráawng phleeng dâai mǎi khráp.

english: I can sing, but Phueng can sing better.
thai: ráawng dâai khâ. dtàae phûeng ráawng gèng gwàa.

english: Which singer do you like most?
thai: bpôen châawp nák-ráawng khon nǎi thîi-sùt khráp.

english: I like Bird the best. How about you?
thai: châawp phîi bòoet thîi-sùt khâ. láaeo jeem lâ khá.

english: I like Sek Loso the best because he can play the guitar really well.
thai: phǒm châawp sèk loo-soo mâak thîi-sùt khráp. phráw khǎo lên gii-dtâa gèng.

english: James, what is the Colorado River like?
thai: jeem mâae-náam khoo-loo-raa-dôo bpen yang-ngai rǒoe khráp.

english: It's wider and faster than the Pai River.
thai: gwâang gwàa láe reo gwàa mâae-náam bpaai khráp.
nâa-gluua gwàa dûuai châi mǎi khá.

english: Yes. it isn't scary at all here.
thai: châi khráp. thîi níi mâi nâa-gluua looei.

english: He is the tallest person in the school
thai: khǎo bpen khon thîi sǔung thîi-sùt nai roong-riian

english: Nit's house is the farthest away out of all my friends
thai: bâan khǎawng phîi nít yùu glai thîi-sùt nai phûuak phûuean khǎawng chǎn

english: The Nile River is the longest river in the world
thai: mâae-náam nai bpen mâae-náam thîi yaao thîi-sùt nai lôok

english: What food do you like the most?
thai: khun châawp aa-hǎan à-rai mâak thîi-sùt

english: Today was so much fun! But a little too wet.
thai: wan-níi sà-nùk mâak looei khráp. dtàae bpìiak bpai nàwy.

english: James, try tasting this chili sauce. It's delicious.
thai: jeem, laawng chim nám-phrík níi sì. à-ràwy ná.

english: How is it? Good? You want some more?
thai: bpen yang-ngai. à-ràwy mǎi. ao ìik mǎi.

english: Uh, that's OK. It's too spicy.
thai: òoe...mâi bpen rai khráp. man phèt gooen bpai.

english: Then eat fish? It's not spicy at all.
thai: ngán gin bplaa mǎi. mâi phèt looei.

english: Sure. Eating fish probably will be better.
thai: khráp. gin bplaa nâa jà dii gwàa.

english: I'm stuffed. I ate too much.
That's what you get. eat too fast this way.
thai: sǒm nám nâa. gin reo gooen bpai gâaw yàang níi làe.

english: The weather is too hot today
I have way too many problems
Don't need to worry. You think too much
thai: mâi dtâwng hùuang. khun khít mâak bpai

english: Ugh, I'm bored. I don't want to study anymore.
thai: óoi...bùuea. mâi yàak àan nǎng-sǔue láaeo.

english: Yeah, I feel so sleepy right now. I'm falling asleep now.
thai: châi-châi...dtaawn níi ngûuang mâak-mâak looei. jà làp yùu láaeo.

english: Well then let's quit studying. Let's go sit at a cafe, talk together better
thai: ngán lôoek àan gan thòe. bpai nâng ráan-gaa-faae khui gan dii gwàa.

english: Benz and James, what do you want to drink?
thai: been jeem ao náam à-rai dii.

english: I'll have an iced coffee. But I'm hungry too. Um, can I get a piece of cake also?
thai: phǒm ao gaa-faae yen khráp. dtàae wâa phǒm hǐu dûuai. uuem...khǎaw khéek dûuai nùeng chín dâai mǎi khráp.

english: I'm so jealous of Apple. Last week she got another new mobile phone.
thai: ìt-chǎa náawng bpôen mâak looei. aa-thít thîi láaeo khǎo thǎawy muue-thǔue khrûueang mài ìik láaeo.
jing rǒoe khráp. rûn nǎi khráp.

english: It's an iPhone. Really, not just bpôen. Iphone huh? Phueng, he has as well.
thai: ai-foon nâ. ôoe...jing-jing láaeo mâi châi khâae náawng bpôen ná. ai-foon nîa? náawng phûeng, khǎo gâaw mii mǔuean gan.

english: Hey, speaking of Phueng. I think she likes you, James.
thai: âaw...phûut thǔeng phûeng, rao khít wâa phûeng châawp jeem ná.

english: Hey, Nune. I can trust you, right?
thai: nûn, rao wái-jai nûn dâai châi mǎi.
hǔuem...dâai sì. mii à-rai rǒoe jeem.

english: It's just, I have something I want to ask you?
thai: khuue rao mii rûueang yàak jà thǎam nûn nàwy nâ.

english: Go ahead and ask. You don't have to feel like you are imposing.
thai: thǎam maa dâai looei. mâi dtâwng greeng-jai jâ.

english: But can you promise with me? That you will not tell the topic that I ask you with anyone?
thai: dtàae nûn sǎn-yaa gàp rao dâai mǎi wâa jà mâi bàawk rûueang thîi rao thǎam nûn gàp khrai.

english: Well, it's that...two days before, Benz told me that Phueng likes me. Is it true?
thai: òoe...khuue..mûuea sǎawng wan gàawn been lâo hâi rao fang wâa phûeng châawp rao. jing rǔue bplàao nûn.

english: It's true. She's interested in you. Um, why don't you try asking her out on a date unlike usual?
thai: châi jâ...phûeng sǒn-jai jeem lâ. uuem...tham-mai jeem mâi laawng chuuan phûeng àawk bpai thîiao duu bâang lâ.

english: You don't have to feel like you are imposing
I was surprised when I saw the ghost
I was happy that I got to meet grandmother
thai: dii-jai thîi dâai jooe khun yaai

english: to feel bad about imposing on others
softer way to say can I/you
use at end of sentence for saying do something you don't usually do
Hello, Phueng. What are you doing now?
thai: sà-wàt-dii khráp phûeng. dtaawn-níi phûeng tham à-rai yùu rǒoe khráp.

english: I'm in the middle of watching TV. What's up?
thai: gam-lang duu thii-wii yùu jâa. jeem mii à-rai rǒoe.
wan-sǎo nâa phûeng wâang mǎi khráp.

english: Go see a movie together? Now the movie "Ghost Panda" that you once said you wanted to see is playing.
thai: bpai duu nǎng gan mǎi khráp. dtaawn-níi nǎng rûueang “phǐi phaaen-dâa” thîi phûeng khooei bàawk wâa yàak duu gam-lang chǎai yùu.
jing rǒoe khá. bpai khâ bpai.

english: Then, meet together in front of Kad Suan Kaew at six o'clock pm good?
thai: ngán jooe gan thîi nâa gàat-sǔuan-gâaeo dtaawn hòk moong-yen dii mǎi khráp.
dii jâ. láaeo jooe gan ná já.
khráp. ngán khâae níi ná khráp. sà-wàt-dii khráp.

english: I'm in the middle of eating a meal
I'm right in the middle of eating a meal
to play (movies), to show, to screen, to shine
I'm glad that you liked it.
Oh, I didn't eat lunch. I'm so hungry now.
thai: òoe...rao mâi dâai gin khâao-glaang-wan nâ jâ. dtaawn-níi hǐu mâak-mâak looei.

english: I'm hungry too. Well, lets go look for what to eat together, good?
thai: phǒm gâaw hǐu mǔuean gan khráp. ngán rao bpai hǎa à-rai thaan gan dii mǎi khráp.

english: What are you going to do after you graduate, James?
thai: jeem riian jòp láaeo jeem jà tham à-rai rǒoe.

english: I haven't decided yet. How about you?
thai: phǒm yang mâi dâi dtàt-sǐn-jai looei khráp. láaeo phûeng lâ khráp.

english: I want to be a flight attendant. But I haven't yet consulted with my parents at all. I don't know that they will allow me to or not.
thai: rao yàak bpen aae-hóos-dtèet jâ. dtàae yang mâi dâi bprùek-sǎa phâaw mâae looei. mâi rúu wâa khǎo jà à-nú-yâat rǔue bplàao.

english: I haven't gone to Sukhothai yet
thai: chǎn yang mâi dâi bpai sù-khǒo-thai

english: Why is it that you want to be a flight attendant?
thai: tham-mai phûeng thǔeng yàak bpen aae-hóos-dtèet rǒoe khráp.

english: Because I would get to travel to foreign countries often.
thai: phráw jà dâai dooen-thaang bpai dtàang-bprà-thêet bàwy-bàwy jâ.

english: And which country do you most want to go to?
thai: láaeo phûeng yàak bpai bprà-thêet à-rai mâak thîi-sùt khráp.

english: Um...I want to go to Switzerland the most.
thai: uuem...yàak bpai bprà-thêet sà-wíit-sooe-laaen mâak thîi-sùt jâ.

english: Because I want to see snow. Since I was born, still never seen snow.
thai: phráw phûeng yàak hěn hì-má jâ. dtâng dtàae gòoet maa yang mâi khooei hěn hì-má looei.

english: There's a lot of snow in America. But I don't like it.
thai: thîi à-mee-rí-gaa mii hì-má yóe mâak looei khráp. dtàae phǒm mâi châawp.

english: Why don't you like it? The snow isn't beautiful?
thai: tham-mai mâi châawp lâ khá. hì-má sǔuai mâi châi rǒoe khá.

english: It's true that snow is beautiful, but I think it's too cold when it's snowing.
thai: jing yùu khráp thîi wâa hì-má sǔuai. dtàae phǒm khít wâa man nǎao gooen bpai wee-laa hì-má dtòk.

english: Why are you going to go to Thailand?
Why do you need to go to Thailand?
thai: tham-mai khun dtâwng bpai muueang-thai (When using a helping verb such as dtâwng then tham-mai comes at the beginning of the question)

english: Why is it that you're going to go to Thailand?
thai: tham-mai khun thǔeng jà bpai muueang-thai (Put together thmai thǔeng means "Why has it become that...?" If you also state the subject, then thǔeng goes after the subject)

english: I'm very hungry because I didn't eat breakfast.
thai: phǒm hǐu mâak phráw wâa mâi dâi gin aa-hǎan-cháao (We use phráw wâa to link separate clauses of a sentence where the second clause gives the reason for what happened in the first clause)

english: James, I heard the news that the day before, you went on a date with Phueng. How was it? Tell me about it.
thai: phîi jeem phîi jeem dâai khàao wâa mûuea wan gàawn phîi jeem bpai dèet gàp phîi-phûeng rǒoe. bpen yang-ngai bâang. lâo hâi fang nàwy sì.

english: Wait, finish eating dinner and I'll tell you. Now order food first. Waitress!
thai: dǐiao thaan khâao sèt láaeo phîi lâo hâi fang ná. dtaawn-níi sàng aa-hǎan gàawn. náawng náawng.
mâae mâae ao sáawt-má-khǔuea-thêet hâi nàwy.

english: It's on the table behind you.
thai: yùu thîi dtó khâang-lǎng mâae nâ.

english: Bring the snacks for me to taste
thai: ao khà-nǒm maa hâi phǒm chin nàwy

english: OK, everyone, for today, that's all. Today's homework for every student, write the letters "daaw chá-daa" to "naaw neen." Write them beautifully, OK, everyone?
thai: ao lâ thúk-khon sǎm-ràp wan-níi gâaw khâae níi. gaan-bâan khǎawng wan-níi hâi nák-riian thúk-khon khǐian dtuua àk-sǎawn “daaw-chá-daa” thǔeng “naaw-neen”. khǐian hâi sǔuai ná khá thúk-khon.

english: Hey, James and Yuki, tonight you free? Go sit and listen to music at the Riverside together?
thai: nîi jeem yuu-gì khuuen níi wâang mǎi. bpai nâng fang phleeng thîi rii-wooe-sai gan mǎi.

english: I'm sorry, Rajeesh. I might not really be able to go too because today is a weekday, my mother won't let me go home late.
thai: khǎaw-thôot jâ raa-jìit...rao khong bpai dûuai mâi dâai ràawk ná já phráw wâa wan-níi bpen wan-tham-má-daa khun-mâae khǎawng rao mâi hâi glàp bâan dùek.

english: Oh, that's OK, Yuki. What about you, James? Can you go?
thai: âaw...mâi bpen rai jâ yuu-gì. láaeo jeem lâ bpai dâai mǎi.

english: I can go, but I have to stop and pick up some clothes for my mother at the laundry shop first.
thai: rao bpai dâai. dtàae wâa dtâwng wáe-ráp sûuea-phâa hâi khun-mâae thîi ráan-sák-rîit gàawn.
dâai sì khráp. mâi mii bpan-hǎa.
phǒm hâi khà-nǒm gàp khun mâae

english: Mother won't let me eat snacks
thai: khun mâae mâi hâi phǒm gin khà-nǒm

english: The boss allowed the employees to go home early
thai: naai hâi phá-nák-ngaan glàp bâan reo (put before a pronoun or noun, (hâi) means "to allow" or "to let")
khun jaawn tham hâi thúk khon rúu-sùek gròot

english: The teacher asked the student to say it another time
thai: khun khruu hâi nák-riian phûut ìik khráng (Subject + hâi(make, ask, force) + Person + Verb)

english: The boss made the employees come in to work on a Sunday
thai: naai hâi phá-nák-ngaan maa tham-ngaan nai wan-aa-thít (Subject + hâi(make, ask, force) + Person + Verb)

english: The students wrote the letters of the alphabet beautifully
thai: nák-riian khǐian dtuua-àk-sǎawn hâi sǔuai (Verb + Object + hâi(until, so that) + Manner/Condition)

english: Wow, there's a lot of people at the Riverside today. Are there going to be any free spaces?
thai: ôo-hǒo...wan-níi rii-wooe-sai khon yóe ná. jà mii thîi-wâang mǎi nîa.

english: Should have. Just a minute. Let's try asking the waitress.
thai: nâa jà mii ná. dǐiao laawng thǎam phá-nák-ngaan-sòoep duu.

english: Waitress! Is there room for two people?
thai: náawng náawng. mii thîi-wâang sǎm-ràp sǎawng khon mǎi khráp.

english: There is. This way, please. What would you like to drink?
thai: mii khâ. chooen thaang níi looei khâ. ráp khrûueang-dùuem à-rai dii khá.

english: What beers do you all have?
We have Singha, Chang, and also Heineken.
thai: mii biia sǐng biia cháang láaeo gâaw biia hai-nee-gên khâ.

english: Well then, we'll have one large bottle of Chang beer and two empty glasses.
thai: ngán ao biia cháang khùuat yài nùeng khùuat gâaeo blàao sǎawng gâaeo khráp.

english: this place has a lot of tourists, aren't there, Rajeesh?
thai: ráan níi mii nák-thâwng-thîiao yóe nóe raa-jìit.

english: Yep. It must be because this place has bands that play Western music.
thai: châi khráp. nâa jà bpen phráw ráan níi mii wong-don-dtrii thîi lên phleeng fà-ràng.

english: That was a very funny show
thai: nân bpen gaan-sà-daaeng thîi dtà-lòk mâak

english: Are there going to be any more performances?
thai: láaeo jà mii gaan-sà-daaeng ìik mǎi

english: This place has a lot of tourists
There are four bottles of beer in the refrigerator
thai: mii biia sìi khùuat nai dtùu-yen

english: Wow! There's a lot of people here. Is today a special occasion, Nune?
thai: oo-hôo..thîi níi khon yóe mâak looei. wan-níi bpen wan phí-sèt à-rai rǔue bplàao khráp nûn.

english: It's not a special day at all, James. This is a "walking street." There are people selling handicrafts. They have it every Sunday. A lot of people is normal like this.
thai: mâi châi wan phí-sèt à-rai looei jeem. thîi-nîi bpen thà-nǒn khon dooen. mii khǎai khǎawng-tham-muue. mii thúk wan-aa-thít. khon jà yóe bpen bpòk-gà-dtì bàaep níi yùu láaeo.

english: Nune, look at that elephant picture. It's really beautiful.
thai: nûn nûn...duu phâap cháang nân sì. sǔuai mâak looei.

english: Which picture, James? There are so many pictures of elephants.
thai: phâap nǎi jeem. mii phâap cháang dtâng lǎai phâap.

english: The picture with the purple elephant. That one.
thai: phâap thîi mii cháang sǐi-mûuang nân ngai.

english: Hey, that really is beautiful too. But I like the picture with the pink elephant better.
thai: ooe...sǔuai jing-jing dûuai. dtàae rao châawp phâap thîi mii cháang sǐi-chom-phuu mâak gwàa.

english: The picture with the two elephants, a gold one and a silver one, is beautiful, huh, Nune?
thai: phâap thîi mii cháang sǎawng dtuua sǐi-thaawng gàp sǐi-ngoen gâaw sǔuai ná nûn.

english: Excuse me. How much is that picture?
thai: khǎaw-thôot khráp. phâap nán raa-khaa thâo-rài khráp.

english: It's not expensive either. I really want to be able to. But it's too big. I don't know how I will take it back home.
thai: mâi phaaeng dûuai. yàak dâai jang. dtàae man yài bpai. mâi rúu jà ao glàp bâan yang-ngai.

english: Just take it in a red-car back homr. And then I can ride the motorcycle back home by myself.
thai: gâaw ao khûen rót-daaeng glàp bâan ngai já. dǐiao rao khìi maaw-dtooe-sai glàp bâan khon-diiao dâai.
sûuea dtuua nán sǔuai jang looei.

english: Ah, it's too small. Oh, that's a really cute skirt! I'll try it on instead. Nice! It fits perfectly.
thai: wáa...lék gooen bpai. ûi...grà-bproong dtuua nán nâa-rák mâak-mâak. laawng sǔuam duu dii gwàa. dii jang...phaaw-dii bpría looei.

english: Look at that hat, Nune. It's pretty cool.
thai: duu mùuak bai nán sì nûn. thêe mâak looei.

english: Try it on, Mister. It's cheap.
thai: laawng sǔuam duu sì khá khun. thùuk-thùuk khâ.

english: Oh, it looks really good, James.
Very cheap. Each one (hat) is four hundred baht.
thai: thùuk-thùuk khâ. bai lá sìi-ráawy bàat.

english: Huh? Four hundred baht is too expensive. Can you lower it?
thai: hǎa...sìi-ráawy bàat phaaeng bpai. lót hâi nàwy dâai mǎi khráp.

english: Three hundred baht is the lowest price.
Ooh, that's too expensive still . I don't want it anymore. Let's just go home, Nune.
thai: hǒoi...gâaw phaaeng bpai yùu dii. mâi ao láaeo dii gwàa. glàp bâan gan thòe nûn.
dǐiao khâ dǐiao. ráawy hâa-sìp bàat ao mǎi.

english: Yesterday, I bought three skirts and a pair of shoes
thai: mûuea-waan-níi dì-chǎn súue grà-bproong sǎam dtuua láe raawng-tháao nùeng khûu

english: I don't like the sky blue swimsuit. I like the pink one
thai: mâi châawp chút-wâai-náam chút sǐi-fáa. châawp chút sǐi-chom-phuu.

english: meaning it's the lowest price they will go
Nune, can you come pick me up at the soccer field?
thai: nûn...maa ráp rao thîi sà-nǎam-fút-bawn nàwy dâai mǎi.

english: What is it, James? Why do you sound like that? What happened?
thai: bpen à-rai nâ jeem. tham-mai sǐiang thǔeng bpen yàang nán. gòoet à-rai khûen.

english: I was crashed into by a friend while playing soccer.
thai: rao thùuk wîng chon duuai phûuean dtaawn lên fút-bawn nâ.

english: Is it very serious? Where all does it hurt?
thai: láao bpen à-rai mâak rǔue bplàao jeem. jèp trong-nǎi bâang.

english: I hurt my arm and my foot. But my foot hurts so bad that I can't walk. I don't know whether I broke a bone or not.
thai: jèp khǎaen gàp tháao. dtàae thîi tháao jèp mâak jon dooen mâi dâai. mâi rúu wâa grà-dùuk hàk rǔue bplàao.

english: Huh? Really? Then just wait right there. I'll hurry and come pick you up right now.
thai: hǎa...jing rǒoe. ngán jeem raaw yùu thîi-nân ná. dǐiao rao jà rîip bpai ráp jeem dǐiao-níi looei jâ.

english: I've got a really bad headache today
I'm sorry. I can't help carry the bags because my waist aches
thai: khǎaw-thôot khráp. phǒm chûuai thǔue grà-bpǎo mâi dâai phráw bpùuat eeo
